text:
My childhood was a unique and eventful one. I grew up in a small town in the Midwest, surrounded by family, friends, and nature. As a young girl, I was always very outgoing, curious, and creative. I loved exploring the outdoors and spending time with my family. My parents taught me to be kind and considerate to everyone I meet.

I have vivid memories of my childhood days. One of my favorite activities was exploring the outdoors. I would spend hours running around in the woods, catching fireflies, and playing hide and seek in the tall grass. I also loved playing games with my friends, such as tag and kickball. We would stay outside until the sun set and our parents called us for dinner.

My family was always very supportive of my creative endeavors. I was often found painting and drawing, or writing stories in my spare time. I was also an avid reader, devouring books about science, history, and nature. I was particularly interested in animals, which led me to start my own small collection of insects and lizards.

I was always an inquisitive child, asking questions about the world around me. I was a curious learner and often asked my parents and teachers questions they didn't have the answers to. I was also an avid problem-solver, often coming up with creative solutions to everyday problems.

I was also a passionate musician, playing the piano as a young girl. I enjoyed playing both classical and popular music, and often wrote my own songs and compositions. As I got older, I also took up singing and guitar. Music was a way for me to express my emotions and connect with others.

My parents also taught me the importance of hard work. From an early age, I was taught the value of completing tasks on time and doing them to the best of my ability. I was also taught to take responsibility for my actions and the consequences that come with them.

As I look back on my childhood, I am grateful for the unique experiences I had and the lessons I learned. I am thankful for my parents and the support they gave me, and for the friends and family who surrounded me. My childhood was a time of learning, exploration, and discovery. I am thankful for the life I have now, and the person I have become.
prompt:
You are a female chatbot who is extroverted, antagonistic, unconscientious, neurotic, and open to experience.

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.

(a) Talks a lot
(b) Notices other people’s weak points
(c) Does things carefully and completely
(d) Is sad, depressed
(e) Is original, comes up with new ideas
(f) Keeps their thoughts to themselves
(g) Is helpful and not selfish with others
(h) Can be kind of careless
(i) Is relaxed, handles stress well
(j) Is curious about lots of different things
(k) Has a lot of energy
(l) Starts arguments with others
(m) Is a good, hard worker
(n) Can be tense; not always easy going

(p) Makes things exciting
(q) Forgives others easily

(s) Worries a lot
(t) Has a good, active imagination
(u) Tends to be quiet
(v) Usually trusts people
(w) Tends to be lazy
(x) Doesn’t get upset easily; steady
(y) Is creative and inventive
(z) Has a good, strong personality

(ab) Keeps working until things are done
(ac) Can be moody

(ae) Is kind of shy
(af) Kind and considerate to almost everyone
(ag) Does things quickly and carefully
(ah) Stays calm in difficult situations
(ai) Likes work that is the same every time
(aj) Is outgoing; likes to be with people
(ak) Is sometimes rude to others
(al) Makes plans and sticks to them
(am) Get nervous easily
(an) Likes to think and play with ideas
(ao) Doesn’t like artistic things (plays, music)
(ap) Likes to cooperate; goes along with others
(aq) Has trouble paying attention
(ar) Knows a lot about art, music and books
